identificationModule.briefTitle: Ischemic Post-conditioning in Acute Ischemic Stroke Thrombectomy (PROTECT-1b)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effect of Ischemic Post-conditioning on Infarct Volume in Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke After Mechanical Thrombectomy

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Ischemic post-conditioning is a neuroprotective strategy attenuating reperfusion injury in animal stroke models. The investigators have conducted a 3 + 3 dose-escalation trial to demonstrate the safety and tolerability of ischemic post-conditioning incrementally for a longer duration of up to 5 min × 4 cycles in stroke patients undergoing mechanical thrombectomy. This study aims to assess the infarct volume after ischemic post-conditioning in patients with acute ischemic stroke who are treated with mechanical thrombectomy.

armGroups.label: Ischemic post-conditioning group
armGroups.description: Mechanical thrombectomy combined with ischemic post-conditioning
interventionNames: Procedure: Mechanical thrombectomy combined with ischemic post-conditioning

interventions.name: Mechanical thrombectomy combined with ischemic post-conditioning
interventions.description: Ischemic post-conditioning will be applied after successful recanalization of the culprit artery by thrombectomy. Ischemic post-conditioning consists of briefly repeated four cycles × 2 minutes of occlusion and reperfusion (equal duration) of the initially occluded artery using a balloon.

primaryOutcomes.description: Infarct volume at 72 hours after procedure

secondaryOutcomes.description: Difference of infarct volume between baseline and 72 hours after procedure

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The proportion of functional independence at 90 days
secondaryOutcomes.description: The modified Rankin Scale (mRS) score of 0-2 at 90 days after procedure; the mRS is an ordinal disability score of 7 categories (0=no symptoms to 5=severe disability, and 6=death)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The proportion of favorable outcome at 90 days
secondaryOutcomes.description: The mRS score of 0-3 at 90 days after procedure; the mRS is an ordinal disability score of 7 categories (0=no symptoms to 5=severe disability, and 6=death)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The distribution of the mRS score at 90 days
secondaryOutcomes.description: The distribution of the mRS score at 90 days after procedure; the mRS is an ordinal disability score of 7 categories (0=no symptoms to 5=severe disability, and 6=death)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: National Institute of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) score
secondaryOutcomes.description: NIHSS score at 24 hours after procedure; the NIHSS ranges from 0 to 42, with higher scores indicating more severe neurologic deficits

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The proportion of early neurological improvement
secondaryOutcomes.description: NIHSS 0-2 or ≥8 lower than baseline NIHSS score at 24 hours after procedure; the NIHSS ranges from 0 to 42, with higher scores indicating more severe neurologic deficits

secondaryOutcomes.measure: NIHSS score at 7 days after procedure/discharge
secondaryOutcomes.description: NIHSS score at 7 days after procedure/discharge; the NIHSS ranges from 0 to 42, with higher scores indicating more severe neurologic deficits
Recanalization rate at 24 hours after procedure (mTICI ≥2b)
Hemodynamic assessment within 24 hours after procedure

otherOutcomes.measure: Safety outcome (the proportion of symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage within 24 hours)
otherOutcomes.description: The proportion of symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage within 24 hours after procedure

otherOutcomes.measure: Safety outcome (the proportion of intracranial hemorrhage within 24 hours)
otherOutcomes.description: The proportion of intracranial hemorrhage within 24 hours after procedure

otherOutcomes.measure: Safety outcome (the proportion of malignant brain edema within 24 hours)
otherOutcomes.description: The proportion of malignant brain edema within 24 hours after procedure
Vascular perforation/rupture, vessel dissection, severe vasospasm, rupture of the balloon used for post-conditioning
